item.title: Issue #2299 created
item.description:
Make the pipe-like operators left associative and have the same precedence

Is it possible to make the operators /, //, !, ?, =>, -> left associative (at least) and have the same precedence? This would avoid (very annoying) extra parenthesis.

Currently, we cannot use /, !, ? after => . For example, the following expression (intentionally simplified) does not work:

 (1,2,3) => exists() ! count(.)

It only works with parenthesis:

 ( (1,2,3) => exists() ) ! count(.)

Is there any compelling reason for this?
